text:
here's just to show that it works but it's not a good solution to change the protrusions directly because they'll be overwritten anytime the ticks etc change
```let
    f = Figure()

    axs = [Axis(f) for i in 1:7]
    for i in 1:7
        f[reverse(fldmod1(i, 2))...] = axs[i]
    end

    hidexdecorations!.(axs[1:2:6])
    prot = axs[7].layoutobservables.protrusions[]
    newprot = MakieLayout.GridLayoutBase.RectSides(prot.left, prot.right, 0f0, <http://prot.top|prot.top>)
    axs[7].layoutobservables.protrusions[] = newprot

    f
end```

elements.text: here's just to show that it works but it's not a good solution to change the protrusions directly because they'll be overwritten anytime the ticks etc change

let
    f = Figure()

    axs = [Axis(f) for i in 1:7]
    for i in 1:7
        f[reverse(fldmod1(i, 2))...] = axs[i]
    end

    hidexdecorations!.(axs[1:2:6])
    prot = axs[7].layoutobservables.protrusions[]
    newprot = MakieLayout.GridLayoutBase.RectSides(prot.left, prot.right, 0f0, prot.top)
    axs[7].layoutobservables.protrusions[] = newprot

    f
end

I’ve added this to <https://github.com/greimel/TabularMakie.jl> (which grew out of <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/AlgebraOfGraphics.jl/issues/136>). You can generate this plot with
```fig = lplot(Scatter, df, :xxx, :yyy; color = :s_c, marker = :g_m,  markersize = :s_m, layout_wrap = :g_lx)```
(but you shouldn’t - this package is a few days old.)

I’d rather like to recycle existing plot functions, though. Is it possible to intercept all plot functions that have a table as a first argument?

E.g. `scatter(df, args…; kwargs…) = TabularMakie.lplot(Scatter, df, args…; kwargs…)`. I know StatsMakie did something similar (and also more amitious). I couldn’t quite figure out how this works. Do you have any hints on how to start?
